text: Marcel Sylvia Winkler (born 29 October 1970) is a retired South African female sprinter who specialised in 100 metres and 200 metres. She won silver medals in both events at the 1992 African Championships in Mauritius, both times finishing behind compatriot Elinda Vorster. She also competed for South Africa in the 1992 Summer Olympics in Barcelona in 100 metres, without progressing to the final. ==International competitions== {| |- !colspan="6"|Representing |- |rowspan=3|1992 |rowspan=2|African Championships |rowspan=2|Belle Vue Maurel, Mauritius | style="background:silver; text-align:center;"| 2nd |100 m |11.31 |- | style="background:silver; text-align:center;"| 2nd |200 m |23.60 |- |Summer Olympics |Barcelona, Spain |40th (q) |100 m |12.01 |- |1993 |World Indoor Championships |Toronto, Canada |19th (q) |60 m |7.46 (NR) |} ==References== ==External links== * * Category:1970 births Category:Living people Category:Sportspeople from Johannesburg Category:South African female sprinters Category:Olympic athletes of South Africa Category:Athletes (track and field) at the 1992 Summer Olympics
title: Marcel Winkler
